intro: Allophylus cuneatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alder, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by orange to red berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Allophylus cuneatus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
